Class LadderAndSnake

java.lang.Object
LadderAndSnake
public class LadderAndSnake extends Object
Author:
Kevin General comment: The LadderAndSnake class is where all the methods for this game to work can be found. This game was designed in a multiple players, but was limited only to two maximum. Disclaimer the methods of this class are able to handle any amount of players, meaning that it can be more than 2 players but has been restricted to two players. Therefore we have to create a parameterized constructor that will take the number of players and if it is above two players set the game and start it with two players. Different methods were created, such as throwing a random dice, picking players order, creating a 2d array for the board to display the position of the players, etc. All the methods and more were then used in the play method which is the inner logic of the game, and makes sure to follow all the rules in the snake and ladder game.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    arrangePlayers(int x, int y)
    This arrangePlayers(int x, int y) method makes the players to throw a dice and sorts them from the one with the lowest dice in the top and the one with the highest dice in the bottom.
    static void
    Board()
    The Board method uses if statements and for loops to create a 2D array which is the board of this game it uses the odd and even rows to put the numbers in the board in the correct order as in the game board sample.
    static void
    checkLadders(int x)
    The method checkLadders(int x), check if the sumMemory[x] of player x, is equal to one of the ladders bottom.
    static void
    checkSnakes(int x)
    The method checkSnakes(int x), check if the sumMemory[x] of player x, is equal to one of the head of the snakes.
    static void
    defineOrderOfDuplicates(int a, int b, int c)
    This method defineOrderOfDuplicates() is a recursive method to define the order of which player will start when they have repeated dices.
    static void
    Displacement(int x)
    The method Displacement updates the sum after a player throws its dice.
    static int
    flipDice()
    This method uses the random from the math function to give us a random number from 1 to 6.
    static void
    IdentifyDuplicates(int x1, int y1)
    This method crosses from the start until the end positions of the array, and put a mark in all the duplicated dice rolls.
    void
    play()
    The play() method is the core of this game, it uses the methods that were written in this class and uses them in the play() method, this where the logic of the game (put the checkSnakes, checkLadders, if one player lands in another player, and other methods in a logical way so the game works as it is intended) are arranged in a easier way and helps to see how the game works in the inside.
    static void
    printBoard()
    The printBoard Method will print the table with the numbers and the players position, and print all the numbers in the board array.
    static void
    printPlayers(int x)
    This method updates players position in the board, then this method is used in the printBoard method.

    This method searches a string in the nbPlayers[][] array from right to left, and gives the position of the string.

    This method searches a string in the nbPlayers[][] array from left to right, and gives the position of the string.
    static void

    This method setLadders() set a 2d Array with the number of ladders such [#Ladders][2] the 2 representing the bottom and top of the ladders.

    static void
    startFromBeginning(int x)
    This method will check if his new sumMemory[] is equal to another player sumMemory[], if that is the case it will give the player that was in the square, a sumMemory of 0 and also update it's nbPlayers[i][3] array to 0.

      public static int flipDice()
      This method uses the random from the math function to give us a random number from 1 to 6.
      Returns:
      the diceRoll.

    • Board

      public static void Board()
      The Board method uses if statements and for loops to create a 2D array which is the board of this game it uses the odd and even rows to put the numbers in the board in the correct order as in the game board sample.

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      The printBoard Method will print the table with the numbers and the players position, and print all the numbers in the board array.

    • play

      public void play()
      The play() method is the core of this game, it uses the methods that were written in this class and uses them in the play() method, this where the logic of the game (put the checkSnakes, checkLadders, if one player lands in another player, and other methods in a logical way so the game works as it is intended) are arranged in a easier way and helps to see how the game works in the inside. Thus this method is the one who contains the while loops and verify that the boolean flag of the game remains false until a player wins.

      Parameters:

    • checkSnakes

      public static void checkSnakes(int x)
      The method checkSnakes(int x), check if the sumMemory[x] of player x, is equal to one of the head of the snakes. If that is the case the sumMemory[x] is updated to the tail of the snake.
      Parameters:
      x - is the the position of a player in his array sumMemmory and nbPlayers.

    • setLadders

      public static void setLadders()
      This method setLadders() set a 2d Array with the number of ladders such [#Ladders][2] the 2 representing the bottom and top of the ladders.

    • checkLadders

      public static void checkLadders(int x)
      The method checkLadders(int x), check if the sumMemory[x] of player x, is equal to one of the ladders bottom. If that is the case the sumMemory[x] is updated to the top of the ladder.
      Parameters:
      x - is the the position of a player in his array sumMemmory and nbPlayers.

    • arrangePlayers

      public static void arrangePlayers(int x, int y)
      This arrangePlayers(int x, int y) method makes the players to throw a dice and sorts them from the one with the lowest dice in the top and the one with the highest dice in the bottom.
      Parameters:
      x - is the start position of the array
      y - is the end position of the array

    • IdentifyDuplicates

      public static void IdentifyDuplicates(int x1, int y1)
      This method crosses from the start until the end positions of the array, and put a mark in all the duplicated dice rolls.
      Parameters:
      x1 - is the start position of the array
      y1 - is the end position of the array

    • defineOrderOfDuplicates

      public static void defineOrderOfDuplicates(int a, int b, int c)
      This method defineOrderOfDuplicates() is a recursive method to define the order of which player will start when they have repeated dices. This method was not only designed for 2 players but for any amount of players making sure every Player is ordered in function of the die he gets in comparison with the other players that got the same die in their same try. Thus this method call itself until make sure that everyone got their just place in the game.
      Parameters:
      a - is the searchStart() which searches for the start position of the repeated dices.
      b - is the searchEnd() which searches for the position end position of the repeated dices.
      c - has the same value of b but it remains untouched through the recursive steps this allows the recursive method to pass over a complete section of repeated dice numbers.

    • searchStart

      public static int searchStart(String sta, int x, int y)
      This method searches a string in the nbPlayers[][] array from left to right, and gives the position of the string.
      Parameters:
      sta - is what this method is searching in the array, in this case Di, where i is the number of the die that was repeated.
      x - is the start of the array in this case normally it is 0, start position.
      y - is the length of the array.
      Returns:
      position of the string or returns -1 if it doesn't found the string.

    • searchEnd

      public static int searchEnd(String en, int x, int y)
      This method searches a string in the nbPlayers[][] array from right to left, and gives the position of the string.
      Parameters:
      en - is what this method is searching in the array, in this case Di, where i is the number of the die that was repeated.
      x - is the start of the array in this case normally it is 0, start position.
      y - is the length of the array.
      Returns:
      position of the string or returns -1 if it doesn't found the string.

    • startFromBeginning

      public static void startFromBeginning(int x)
      This method will check if his new sumMemory[] is equal to another player sumMemory[], if that is the case it will give the player that was in the square, a sumMemory of 0 and also update it's nbPlayers[i][3] array to 0.
      Parameters:
      x - is the position in the sumMemory[] array that has just played it's turn.

    • printPlayers

      public static void printPlayers(int x)
      This method updates players position in the board, then this method is used in the printBoard method.
      Parameters:
      x - is the position of the player in the sumMemory[] array.
